alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 1:49AM MST until February 26 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM MST SUNDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Expect periods of snow to develop from west to east late Saturday evening and into Sunday morning. Although snow levels will initially be around 6000-6500 feet, snow levels will drop quickly early Sunday morning. The heaviest and most impactful snow amounts will be above 5000-6000 feet, along with blowing and drifting snow as southwest winds gust from 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Payson, Pine-Strawberry, Shonto and Valle. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 2 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from 10 PM Today to 2 PM Sunday: Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches Jacob Lake 3 to 5 inches North Rim 3 to 5 inches Payson 2 to 4 inches Pine-Strawberry 4 to 8 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches Valle 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County
